column13: The Board has established a Risk Management Framework incorporating a formal, Board approved Risk Appetite Statement (RAS) setting the parameters within which the Board expects management to operate. To strengthen the relationship between risk management, including those risks related to climate change, and strategic and operational planning, the Managing Director is principally responsible for risk management.
column20: Risk Appetite Statement, Strategic Guidelines, Risk Parameters

column13: Internal audit is a critical component of QUBE Holdings's assurance framework. The primary objective of internal audit is to provide an assurance framework to underpin the risk management program. It includes reviews of processes and controls over high risks and where there is high control reliance as determined through the risk planning process.
column20: Internal Audit, Assurance Framework, Risk Mitigation

column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column7: There are many different avenues for reporting a breach - who you should contact will depend on the circumstances. In most cases, raising violations of the Code or policies and procedures with your supervisor, manager, or human resources representative will be appropriate. There may be times when it is inappropriate to raise a concern within your business unit, in which case you may contact the Company Secretary.

The Board is responsible under ASX Corporate Governance Principle 7 for QUBE Holdings to have established a sound Risk Management Framework that identifies and manages risk and periodic review of its effectiveness.
Healthy Heads in Trucks and Sheds (HHTS).

column13: We established a Culture Reference Group (CRG), comprised of representatives from across the Group at different levels and with a mix of operational, administrative and corporate support roles. The CRG will assist in embedding our Thrive program across the business and help generate employee engagement and enthusiasm.
column20: Culture Reference Group, Employee Engagement, Thrive Program

column7: The process began with analysing global sustainability megatrends most likely to impact QUBE Holdings's current prospects. BWD conducted 20 interviews with senior executives, including the Chair of the Board, various Board members, and leading executives across QUBE Holdings's verticals. One external stakeholder was interviewed. A desktop review of internal policies, procedures and existing enterprise risks complemented the interviews. All risks and opportunities were rated referencing QUBE Holdings's enterprise risk framework. Risks and opportunities were grouped into five material issues that have the most potential to influence QUBE Holdings's prospects and success. Other impact areas were identified, though they must still be considered to meet the materiality threshold. QUBE Holdings will continue to monitor these in the future.

column13: Our strategy considers the potential impacts of climate change on our operations and value chain. Our climate strategy includes reducing greenhouse gas emissions, improving efficiency, and promoting sustainable practices throughout our operations. We consider the physical and transitional risks associated with climate change, including regulatory changes, market trends, and technological advancement, to ensure our strategy is future-proof and resilient.
column20: Climate Change Strategy, Greenhouse Gas Reduction, Resilience Planning

column13: As QUBE Holdings continues its climate journey, more comprehensive data collection, analysis, and modelling will improve future analyses and estimates. In FY24, we intend to further evolve physical and transitional climate-related risk analysis by conducting scenario analysis as required under the ISSB standards.
column20: Climate Risk Analysis, Scenario Planning, ISSB Standards

column8: Capital allocation and targets investments approach
column13: QUBE Holdings has a disciplined approach to capital allocation and targets investments that fit both strategically and will deliver an appropriate return, considering relevant factors, including QUBE Holdings's applicable weighted average cost of capital (WACC) and the risk associated with the investment. Certain more strategic or lower-risk investments may justify lower return outcomes, while higher-risk investments are expected to generate a higher premium to the WACC.
column20: Capital Allocation Strategy, Risk-adjusted Returns, Strategic Investments

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: Investment in 32 new Tier 3 locomotives would reduce NOx and PM by over 50% to 80% and consume less oil, filters and components.
column20: Locomotive Investment, Emissions Reduction, Fuel Efficiency

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: Forty-three new Kalmar Tier IV/Stage 5 emission standard container handler units ordered will significantly improve fuel efficiency and lower emissions.
column20: Container Handler Investment, Emission Standards, Fuel Efficiency

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column13: We also continue investing in renewable energy across facilities we own or lease to power them with 100 per cent renewable electricity by 2030. Further, we are investing in data management services to provide transparency and visibility of GHG emissions and collecting broader sustainability data, including waste and water data, to improve our reporting and climate-related disclosures.
column20: Renewable Energy Investment, GHG Emission Reduction, Data Management

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: As an organisation committed to strengthening sustainability, we recognise the importance of disclosing climate-related risks and opportunities to our stakeholders. We embrace the recommendation of the Taskforce on Climate-related Financial Disclosures (TCFD). We are taking steps to manage our climate-related risks across the governance, risk management and strategy, create value, and build resilience in our supply chain.
column20: Climate-related Financial Disclosures, TCFD Recommendations, Supply Chain Resilience

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: QUBE Holdings conducted a detailed assessment via stakeholder engagement to assess the materiality of the identified risks. The evaluation was based on identifying risk using the QUBE Holdings risk matrix (risk rating ranging from very low to extreme) and a series of workshops with relevant QUBE Holdings businesses.
column20: Risk Matrix, Assessment, Identification

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: An internal model was developed to assess transitional risks through 2030. The agreed topics were EV uptake, battery technology, alternative fuels, regulations, carbon pricing, and the government approach to net zero. Three scenarios were assessed to identify and evaluate future transitional climate risk.
column20: Transitional Risk Assessment, Scenario Modelling, Climate Strategy

Ratios of standard entry level wage by gender compared to local minimum wage
Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
column7: We'll never stop striving to do better with more innovative technology, innovation, and relationships that ensure success for our customers, business, shareholders and all our people.

column13: Significant investment in camera technology with Artificial Intelligence (AI) across key sites to deliver enhanced safety and workforce protection. These cameras can detect and alert if team members enter an unsafe zone. The appropriate management teams are alerted to these breaches to help keep our sites safe.
column20: AI Camera Technology, Safety Enhancement, Workforce Protection

column8: The expansion of our Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
column13: The expansion of our Optical Character Recognition (OCR) tools in select locations to drive efficiencies in moving assets. QUBE Holdings has now successfully fitted OCR cameras on non-fixed forks and cranes with OCR feeds back into the QUBE Holdings OCR engine.
column20: OCR Tools, Asset Movement Efficiency, Automation

column13: Expansion of robotic scanning technologies across new sites, helping to unlock a range of safety and efficiency benefits. QUBE Holdings delivered a successful proof of concept trial with drone warehouse scanning for cycle counting in one of our central warehouse facilities. The prosecution utilised drones to scan pallets in a warehouse for cycle counting.
column20: Robotic Scanning, Safety Improvement, Efficiency Gains

column8: Innovative New Cattle Ramp Keeps Herds Moving
column13: A new livestock loading ramp at Darwin Port is streamlining the delivery of large consignments of export cattle while maintaining animal welfare and worker safety standards. The new ramp, a collaboration between QUBE Holdings, major cattle exporter Frontier International and Argyle Engineering in Kununurra, can complete loading into a G-class vessel in almost half the time and twice as efficiently as was previously possible.
column20: Livestock Loading Ramp, Animal Welfare, Efficiency Increase

column13: As well as celebrating our values and the behaviours they underpin through our inaugural Thrive awards Ã¢ÂÂ "The Qubies", in FY23, we also launched the QUBE Holdings Innovation Award. This award recognises the importance of innovation for QUBE Holdings's sustained growth and future success.
column20: Awards Recognition, Innovation Culture, Employee Engagement

column13: In a world first, this year we completed a trial of our new Super B Double Double Stacked vehicle container vehicle Ã¢ÂÂ the first design of its kind globally and dubbed "The London Project" in homage to London's iconic double-decker buses. The trailer, developed by QUBE Holdings with O'Phee Trailers and the Drake Group, can transport up to twelve empty double-stacked containers and be trialled on a defined route through the Port of Brisbane, predominantly within QUBE Holdings's site port facilities and limited port roads. It made it the first time a double-stacked container vehicle had been trialled on public roads in Australia.\t
column20: Double-Stacked Container Trial, Transportation Efficiency, Innovative Design

column13: QUBE Holdings has an Anti-Bribery and Anti-Corruption Policy that applies to all QUBE Holdings personnel, contractors, agents, and advisers. It explains prohibited conduct and provides guidance on dealing with gifts, entertainment and donations and seeking appropriate approvals.
